p: The most commonly used plant part was the stem, which was used for almost half of the species (82 spp. (49%)), followed by the root (59 spp. (36%)), the leaf (31 spp. (19%)), bark (20 spp. (12%)), fruit (14 spp. (8%)), rhizome (8 spp. (5%)), flower and shoot (4 spp. each (2% each)), while whole plant, sap and seed were used in only 2 spp. each (1% each).
